12gauge.description: A 12 gauge buckshot round. Can be loaded into shotguns, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.

556round.description: A rifle round. Can be loaded into a rifle magazine, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.

9mmround.description: A small handgun round. Can be loaded into a small magazine, or directly into the chamber if the gun's bolt is open.

adhesivebandage.description: A pack of small medical dressings, made to treat small injuries. Lowers bleeding.

alcohol.description: Glass bottle that can hold 0.4L of liquid.

alginate.description: Dressing derived from carbohydrate sources released by clinical bacterial species, in the same manner as biofilm formation. Slows bleeding, highly improves skin healing and counteracts infections

analgesicgauze.description: Woven gauze made of cotton, containing analgesic drugs. Decent at slowing bleeding and reducing pain from injuries.

animalflesh.description: A ripped piece of meat from a deceased animal, native to this planet. While it is very similar to your own, it's somewhat edible, even if slightly sickening.

antibiotics.description: A 100ml pill bottle of antibiotic pills. Dosage is 20ml.

antidepressants.description: A 140ml pill bottle of antidepressants. Dosage is 20ml.

antirad.description: A 100ml pill bottle with a cool radiation sign on it. Dosage is 20ml.

antisepticmush.description: Smushed together bits of fruit and foliage, resulting in a mixture effective in treating infections. Lasts one use.

antiserum.description: A 100ml syringe with an autoinjector at the end. Dosage is 50ml.

applejuice.description: A carton that can hold 0.8L of liquid. Feels... natural.

armwarmers.description: A pair of blue arm warmers. Provides some insulation against the cold.

autoautopump.description: Attaches to your thigh and automatically activates when you go into a critical state, keeping your oxygen at livable levels and providing energy, but only once.

autoinjector.description: A medical marvel when it was invented, this little device is able to automatically find a vein or artery to inject to and deliver the provided dosage. Used in medicinal crafting.

autopump.description: When used, attaches to your chest, keeps your oxygen at livable levels, and provides adrenaline and energy for 5 minutes, potentially buying you more time. One-time use.

autozoomgoggles.description: A pair of goggles that have the ability to zoom in the user's vision to see farther.

balaclava.description: A thick, padded piece of cloth to go around your skull. Offers minor protection and decent insulation.

banana.description: A tasty yellow fruit, seemingly from another planet. Slightly radioactive.

bandage.description: A roll of dressing with a bandage, used to slow down bleeding, stabilize fractures and aid skin healing. Has no effect on muscle health.

bandolier.description: A pocketed belt that goes over your shoulder, made to hold ammunition. Can hold firearm rounds.

bellyarmor.description: A big piece of metal, made to be strapped on your abdomen. Provides great protection, and some insulation.

belt.description: A leather belt to go over your belly. You could attach something to it.

bikehelmet.description: A helmet designed to reduce the severity of impacts to the head. Reduces head injuries from falls.

bleach.description: A 1.5L plastic bottle, made to hold bleach.

blindfold.description: A black piece of cloth to cover your eyes with. Offers slight protection, but closes your character's eyes.

blobflesh.description: Oddly gooey piece of flesh. Filling and tasty! Might make you minorly sick.

bloodbag.description: A 0.75L plastic bag with an autoinjector at the end. Injects 375mL on use. Use in the inventory to draw blood from yourself.

bloodbaghuman.description: A 0.75L plastic bag with an autoinjector at the end. Injects 375mL on use. Use in the inventory to draw blood from yourself. There's traces of red on it.

bloodcoagulant.description: A 100ml syringe with an auto-injector at the end. Dosage is ~34mL.

bloodcrystalshard.description: Seeps blood into anything it touches. Slowly increases your blood volume up to normal levels while stored on your body.

bloodsac.description: A small, fleshy sac with blood in it. Doesn't look too different from your blood. Can be eaten or used in crafting.

blueprint.description: Has the recipe for some kind of object written on it. There is some kind of electronic chip attached to it... Use to learn the recipe and gain INT experience.

boneweldingtool.description: A very experimental bit of technology that welds a fracture back together, vastly speeding up healing. Causes some damage to the limb due to the process - better have some dressing ready.

bowlofcereal.description: A foliage bowl that can hold 0.5L of liquid. Somehow, you're unable to create it without the cereal.

boxof12gauge.description: A box that can store sixteen 12-Gauge rounds. Use to unload a shell to insert into a firearm.

bread.description: A loaf of bread, made of flour and water. About the simplest thing you could eat, though not repulsive and will last for a long time.

brokenbag.description: An old, heavily worn school bag. The straps are torn and unusable, rendering the bag unwearable.

browncap.description: You aren't sure what kind of fungus it is exactly. For all you know, it could do anything from curing wounds to killing you on the spot.

bruisekit.description: A combination of drugs and other medicines, made to aid muscle healing. Increases muscle/skin health and highly aids dislocations. Doesn't affect bleeding.

bucketofchicken.description: A bunch of chicken legs in a bucket. Very filling.

bulbskin.description: An oily piece of thick, yellow plant skin. Contains a high amount of adrenaline and is slightly hydrating, but might minorly affect brain function. Can also be used as a makeshift bandage and limb analgesic.

bunchunk.description: A piece of fungus with clot-promoting properties. While not particularly useful on its own, it could be refined further...

bundleofwires.description: Bundle of neatly tied together wires with some isolation around them. Used in electronics crafting.

burger.description: A big, tasty snack. Fills both your tummy and soul!

cactusflesh.description: Sweet, high in water content and prickly. Tasty and hydrating, but it hurts to eat.

cake.description: A baked, sweet pastry with some glaze layered ontop. Large, filling and very tasty, though the sugar content makes it a little sickening if eaten too much.

campfire.description: A lit campfire. Warm and cozy, you'll heat up when next to it. Used as a heat source in a variety of food recipes.

candybar.description: A nice, tasty candy bar. Lasts long, but not very filling. Might make you sick if overeaten.

canteen.description: Simple, small bottle for holding liquids, made with some glued together chunks of plastic tied together with rope. Holds 300mL.

canvas.description: Thin, flexible sheet made of plant matter. Light and decently durable for what it is.

carapace.description: A sturdy steel carapace to protect your thorax. Feels royal.

carcass.description: The hard, crushed remains of a sizeable insect. Used in crafting.

carcasssplint.description: A hard, long tube made from multiple joined carcasses. Functions as a decent makeshift splint for treating fractures.

casing.description: Empty casing. While it's not of much use by itself, you could use it in crafting.

ceftriaxone.description: A 100ml syringe that can inject fluid intravenously. This one has a small bottle next to it to draw from.

cereal.description: A box of generic cereal. Not exactly fun to eat dry, but it's filling and not repulsive. Slightly increases thirst.

charcoal.description: Small, light piece of charcoal. Can be used as a flammable ingredient for crafting.

chestdrain.description: Used to drain fluid from the thorax. Reduces hemothoraces, reusable after some time. Only usable on the chest.

chips.description: A pack of thin, baked slices of potato. Tasty, but not the healthiest.

chocolatebar.description: A bar of unpackaged chocolate. Tasty, but you can't digest it well.

chocolatemilk.description: A large plastic bottle that holds up to a liter of liquid.

circuitboard.description: A bit of circuitry, ripped out of a once working machine. It still sparks occasionally. Used in crafting.

claws.description:
Even though it looks like a toy, it's scarily tough and sharp. You feel like you'd look cool holding it.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

climbingclaws.description: A pair of steel claws that go over your hands, specifically designed to attach to walls effectively. Grants you the ability to walljump on the same wall indefinitely.

climbingrope.description: A long, strengthened sheet of rope with attachment points at each end. You could place it over a large drop and use it to climb down. Has two uses.

clottingmush.description: A small vial of a clot-promoting poultice. Needs to be held in a special container in order to not go bad. While not particularly useful on its own, it could be refined further...

coffee.description: A paper cup that can hold 0.25L of liquid.

combatpen.description: A 100ml injector pen which instantly injects its contents into the body. Contains a mixture intended to quickly stabilize casualties and aid in combat scenarios.

cookies.description: A pack of small, baked sweet snacks. Tasty, but not the healthiest.

craftingbottle.description: Improvised water container. Cannot be refilled and will soon disappear. Transfer the contents somewhere before it's gone.

crudecleaver.description:
Cobbled together metal cleaver, with a blade nailed onto the handle. Would do well in crafting. You feel uneasy holding it.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

digestioncrystalshard.description: It feels as if it's taking matter out of your body... Decreases sickness while stored on your body.

disinfectant.description: A 0.2L plastic bottle with a spray nozzle on it. Can spray 10ml of liquid at a time.

drillrepairkit.description: A small bundle of spare parts, made to repair Drill Pods. You could use one of these to get a pod back into a working state.

dryfoliage.description: Seems slightly more appealing to consume when it's dry. Might make you a little sick.

duffelbag.description: A decently sized bag made of fabric.

dustmask.description: A slightly sturdy mask that covers your mouth. Offers minor head protection.

dynamite.description: An explosive made of nitroglycerin, sorbents, and stabilizers. Good for making holes in the terrain. Not very good for your ears.

emergencylight.description: A tiny, one-time use emergency flashlight. You'll probably want to find a new source of light before it runs out. Use to toggle.

emissivecrystalshard.description: Glows brightly, for a time. Useful as a light source while it lasts.

energydrink.description: A 0.25L soda can with bright markings on it.

epda.description: Electronic personal digital assistant, likely accidentally left in a lifepod by your captors. If you get a battery into it, you could probably read up on their notes.

experimentflesh.description: A ripped piece of flesh from one of your own. Filling, but sickening.

fannypack.description: A small bag made to be put on your belly.

fentanyl.description: A 100ml syringe that can inject fluid intravenously. This one comes with diluted fentanyl for pain relief. The overdose label reads 20ml.

filterstraw.description: Can be used to safely drink groundwater and reduce the health impact of other liquids when held in the main hand. Also works when drinking from bottles.

firestarter.description: A device to start a fire by friction between a rapidly rotating wooden rod and a cavity on a stationary wood piece. In layman's terms, stick rotatey, fire starty. Can be used up to 3 times before burning out.

flammablepowder.description: A chalky and highly flammable powder. Useful in making explosives.

flashlight.description: Lights up a large area in front of it, but slowly loses battery. Use to change mode.

fleshchunk.description: A giant, very fatty chunk of flesh. Must've came from something big. Very filling and fattening.

flexiglass.description: A thin sheet of flexible, transparent material, made from chemically treated plastic. Used in crafting.

flimsyknife.description:
A small, dull, brittle knife. Can be used for rudimentary crafting. Little to no use in combat.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

foliage.description: Generic alien plant life. Barely edible, with a dissatisfying taste. Might make you sick. Decays fast. Often used in crafting.

foliagebag.description: A very flimsy bag made of tied together foliage.

foliagemeal.description: A decent prepared food, made of crispy foliage and rudimentary filling. Won't last for long and has no fat, but it's very filling.

frigiantfruit.description: A very cold, hard and glassy fruit. Tasty, but has a tendency to cool you down a lot. Consider not consuming it out in the freezing cold.

funguschunk.description: A ripped piece of fungi. Does a decent enough job as food, though you're unsure about the side effects.

geigefruit.description: An odd, rectangular shiny fruit. Smells of oil, but tastes nice! Refills hunger and thirst. Can mess with your lungs for a moment, and may randomly help or intensify radiation sickness slightly. Has a loud reaction when impacting the ground at speeds - useful for checking drop height.

geofruit.description: Basic, but tasty fruit. Grows on geo-trees. Low in calories, reduces some thirst and decays fast.

glowplantfruit.description: Bioluminescent and inedible. Has moderately dangerous toxins inside; counteracts infections. Its juice promotes chemical reactions, making it useful in crafting.

grapplinghook.description: A metal device that launches a hook attached with a rope. The instruction manual is missing.

gravbag.description: A very experimental container that generates negative gravity in order to reduce the weight of whatever's in it. Has explosive tendencies when its battery nears empty.

hardcandy.description: A pack of small, hard candy. Tasty, but not filling.

headlamp.description: A little flashlight, made to be strapped onto your forehead. Loses battery over time.

heavydrill.description: A big, heavy, mechanical handheld drill. Very efficient, though lacks range.

heroin.description: A 150ml syringe that can inject fluid intravenously. This one is missing the graduation marks and dosage guides.

holidayhat.description: You've heard that people wear these for some kind of special occassion, though you're not sure what it's about. It's nice that you were sent with one, at least.

hoodie.description: A black, very oversized hoodie that keeps you warm and has a small pocket.

icepack.description: A cold bag filled with self-cooling refrigerant gel. Speeds up muscle healing, reduces pain and cools you down slightly. Automatically cools itself over time.

icetea.description: A 0.5L bottle. This one has an orange tint to it.

ilmenitechunk.description: A titanium-iron oxide mineral. Though costly, it can be processed into a strong titanium alloy.

internalorgans.description: A solid compressed ball of displaced internal organs, you can see an orange eyeball sticking out. Looks like they came from a creature sized closely to you. Filling, but horribly disgusting and sickening.

jetpack.description: A device worn as a backpack which uses jets to propel the wearer through the air. Has limited fuel and won't work while wet. Hold W to use.

keratinbooster.description: A 100mL bottle labelled as a nail care supplement. Dosage is 50mL per drink.

kneepads.description: Plastic pads, made to protect the knees and cushion impacts.

lantern.description: A simple, wood and glass lantern with a bright yellow crystal inside of it.

largebattery.description: A large industrial battery that can be inserted into certain electornic devices. Stores three times as much as a medium battery.

largecarcass.description: Two insect carcasses joined together, forming a half-tube shape. Used in crafting.

latexgloves.description: A pair of simple latex gloves. Offers minor insulation from the elements.

lcdscreen.description: A simple electronic display, used in crafting.

legpouch.description: A leather pouch with straps made to go around the thigh. It's like a pocket pocket!

lemonade.description: A jar that can hold 0.75L of liquid. Surprisingly tough.

lightbulb.description: An electric light with a filament that is heated until it glows. Seems to be battery powered. Don't put it in your mouth.

lighter.description: A generic flip top lighter. Can be used as a flame source for many crafting recipes, such as lighting campfires. Lasts many, many uses.

limbwraps.description: Makeshift wraps made from gauze to cover the extremities. Slightly protects your arms and feet from damage and makes you feel like a warrior.

liquidcentrifuge.description: A handheld centrifuge that can inefficiently split a mixture into its base components. The process is rather complex and results in about two thirds of the total liquid volume being lost. Recharges every 60 seconds.

liquidpouch.description: A flexible liquid pouch made to store liquids. Has a strap to go over your belly. You can fill it with bottles and vice-versa.

lockpickingkit.description: A small array of tools used to efficiently get all sorts of locks open. Have it in your main inventory when picking a lock to use. Needs 10 INT to use, effectiveness scales with higher INT.

lrd.description: A Localized Resuscitation Device, made to easily provide effective general trauma care. Increases limb health, slows bleeding, provides pain relieving drugs and disinfects the limb it's used on, along with any adjacent limbs. Highly reduces internal bleeding if used on the chest. Requires atleast 25mL of LRD serum to function.

machete.description:
A big, broad metal blade. Would do well in melee combat. You feel uneasy holding it.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

magazinebase.description: A specially shaped container with a spring in it. Used in magazine and firearm making.

makeshiftdiggingtool.description: A piece of thrown together and tied up metal, made for digging through rock. It's a bit flimsy.

makeshiftheadlamp.description: It's just a glowplant fruit strapped to your forehead. Not exactly comfortable, but frees up some inventory space.

makeshifthelmet.description: A rudimentary helmet made out of some rope and stitched together carcasses. Provides some head protection.

makeshiftlrd.description: A makeshift Localized Resuscitation Device. Looks like it's taped together. Increases the muscle health and disinfects limb it's used on, AND any directly adjacent limbs. Slightly reduces internal bleeding if used on the chest. Requires atleast 25mL of LRD serum to function.

makeshiftrifle.description: An improvised bolt-action firearm, made of scrapped together tubes and gun scraps. Uses small magazines loaded with 9mm rounds. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.

makeshiftwrench.description: A crude tool that's probably better at hitting bolts into place than actually turning them. It won't help with dislocations, but is useful in crafting.'

materialpouch.description: A large, sturdy pouch that attaches to your thigh, with many small pockets to hold crafting materials. Has a high encumbrance reduction, but only accepts very small items.

medicalsuture.description: Used to stitch wounds back together. Instantly stops most bleeding and increases skin health.

mediumbattery.description: A generic battery that can be inserted into various electronic devices. Stores twice as much as a small battery, but a third as much as a large one.

medkit.description: A small box, made to hold medicine.

milk.description: A carton that can hold a liter of liquid.

mindwipe.description: A 60ml pill bottle. Because mindwiping is a painful process, it comes with an equal mix of morphine to ease the transition slightly.

minibarrel.description: A small, industrial barrel made for storing liquids. Extremely heavy and impractical to use.

minilaserdrill.description: A small, consumer-grade laser drill. Not the best at digging, but uses no stamina.

morphine.description: A 100ml syringe that can inject fluid intravenously. The overdose label reads 88ml.

mp3player.description: Surprisingly, it still seems to work. It has a small storage drive, with a few music tracks saved on it. You could play either of them for your own amusement.

musharm.description: Inedible plant part, useful as a one-time makeshift bandage.

mushball.description: A round, edible, bubble-like watery fruit. Looks and feels a little disgusting, but has high water content. Decays very fast.

mushpear.description: A blue plant part, made to distribute water. Barely edible, with a weird weight-absorbing property and off-putting taste. Lowers body mass when eaten. Seems to have trace opiate concentration.

mushtail.description: The end tail of a mushplant. Contains a chemical which can instantly knock someone out for a while, with a visible mood increase afterwards. Odd. No nutritional value.

nails.description: A pile of crudely made nails. Should be enough to last a few recipes. You'll probably need a hammer to drive them.

naloxone.description: A 100ml syringe that can inject fluid intravenously. You can't make out the brand's name other than the "N".

neuralbooster.description: An advanced mix of drugs that alters the structure and function of your brain, slightly increasing your mobility permanently. You might not want to use it more than once.

nondescriptcan.description: A bland, unlabeled can of... something. It doesn't look or smell like anything in particular. Might be good, might be not.

nopopcorn.description: Empty paper bucket. You could store something in it.

nutrientbar.description: Solid, edible bar of pure nutrients and calories. Neutral taste, and doesn't spoil.

opium.description: A 100ml syringe that can inject fluid intravenously. The overdose label says 200ml.

oxygencrystalshard.description: It's bubbling away slowly, releasing oxygen into anything around it... Increases stamina regeneration while stored on your body.

paincream.description: A small 100ml bottle used to hold relief cream. Dosage is 10ml.

pancake.description: A layered flat, sweet batter cooked on a hot surface, covered in syrup. Might get into your fur. Tasty!

paprikash.description: A paste made from ground fish, rice, tomato paste and vegetable oil, seasoned with onion, salt and spices. It looks and smells rather appealing.

pemmican.description: A mixture of fat, dried meat, and dehydrated fruit. Lasts a long time and is very calorie-dense. Tastes neutral.

pickaxe.description: A tool specially crafted to dig rock. Very efficient at removing terrain, though slow.

pistol.description: A basic, semi-automatic handgun. Uses small magazines loaded with 9mm rounds. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.

pitchfork.description: An agricultural tool used to pitch loose material, such as hay, straw, manure, or leaves. Made of steel.

pizzaslice.description: A slice of baked pizza. Very tasty, filling and fattening!

plasmacutter.description: A device that generates a directed flow of plasma. Very good at cutting through metal blocks. Can be used in the health panel to cauterize wounds.

plasticbandage.description: A roll of specially synthesized tough material, made to efficiently cover wounds and stabilize fractures. Has no effect on muscle health.

plasticchunk.description: A chunk of flexible plastic which has been visibly forcibly displaced. Usable in crafting, mainly in electronics.

plushie.description: It makes a squeaky noise when you squish it. You could take your frustration out on it when feeling down...

popcorn.description: A bucket containing a bunch of corn kernels, puffed up from being heated. You find it to be quite a novel concept. Tasty.

pouch.description: A small green bag made of woven synthetic fiber. Has no handle.

present.description: A decorated paper box, seemingly filled with something. Use it to unpack it.

primitivediggingtool.description: A piece of sharp, heavy metal on a stick. Better at digging than claws.

processedcopper.description: Chunk of bio-chem processed copper. Malleable and conductive, you could turn it into wiring for electronics.

purpleherb.description: A dry, purple leaf with a coarse texture. Commonly used as an aid for certain afflictions - helps against sickness, slightly helps hearing loss and might lessen internal bleeding. Use with caution - it has a tendency to highly increase the consumer's body temperature.

purse.description: A handled medium-sized bag used to carry personal items. Quite stylish!

rag.description: A worn, crumpled up rag. Can be used as decent makeshift dressing.

rake.description: Used for softening soil, along other things. Makes you feel like a farmer!

rangefinder.description: A device used to measure distances to remote objects. Tells you the distance to whatever you're pointing at when used.

rawcopper.description: Raw chunk of heavily oxidized copper. You could refine it for use in electronics.

reliefcrystalshard.description: You feel a little numb holding it... Decreases pain while stored on your body.

rifle.description: A stockless, fully automatic rifle. Uses rifle magazines loaded with 5.56 rounds. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.

riflemagazine.description: A universal rifle magazine that accepts 5.56 rounds.

ringersolution.description: A 0.7L bag with a needle at the end, for injecting fluids intravenously.

rippeddressing.description: A small pile of ripped clothing. Can be used as a makeshift bandage for bleeding wounds.

rope.description: A few bits of foliage, tied together into a rope. Used for crafting.

roselight.description: A bright, far reaching yellow light that came from a sand rose. While it decays fast, it's useful for checking how big a drop is. Also reveals hidden infections if used on a limb.

rosepod.description: A part of a sand rose. Doesn't spoil. Can be opened.

ryebulb.description: A thin sack filled with grain. You could pound it down into a flour if you had a hammering tool.

ryeflour.description: A powder mainly used in making baked goods. You'll probably need some water and a heat source to work with it.

safetyglasses.description: A sturdy pair of plastic glasses. Offers minor head protection.

saline.description: A 0.75L bag with a needle at the end, for injecting fluids intravenously.

scaffoldingpack.description: A hyper-compressed box of scaffolding, made to be easily placed down. Lasts 100 uses.

scarf.description: Red, warm, and fuzzy, this long scarf provides some insulation from the elements. Makes you feel like a mercenary...

scrapcube.description: Solid cube made of melted scrap metal. Not particularly strong, but will do in crafting.

scrapmetal.description: Bits and pieces of steel from destroyed machinery. Can be placed down if above 25% condition. Commonly used as currency between survivors, and for crafting.

scrappanel.description: Thin sheet of scrap metal. Not partiularly strong, but will do in crafting.

scraptube.description: Hollow tube made of scrap metal. Not partiularly strong, but will do in crafting. Could act as a shoddy makeshift hammer.

scubadivinggear.description: Lets you indefinitely breathe and regenerate stamina underwater, makes you move faster in liquids and dries you out quickly after resurfacing. The pool floaties are retrofitted.

shotgun.description: A stockless, pump-action shotgun with an internal magazine. Uses 12 gauge shells loaded directly into the gun. Might jam when wet or low condition. Hold in your main hand to use and see controls.

shovel.description: A tool specially crafted to efficiently displace soil and other loose materials. While you haven't seen one of these before in your life, using it isn't exactly a science.

sickle.description:
A metal tool with a curved blade, made to harvest crops or cut through vegetation.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

sledgehammer.description: A tool with a large, flat metal head, attached to a long handle. Not made for digging.

sleepingpills.description: A blister pack containing 25ml worth of pills. Dosage is 5ml. The brand name is missing.

slingbag.description: A foliage bag with added reinforcements, made to be worn on your back.

smallbattery.description: A small battery that can be inserted into various electronic devices. Stores half as much as a medium battery.

smallmagazine.description: A universal handgun magazine that accepts 9mm rounds.

sneakers.description: A pair of white sneakers, that are not at all made to go over your feet. If you manage to somehow squish your paws in them, provides protection from glass shards.

soothingcrystalshard.description: It has a calming aura to it. Slowly increases happiness while stored on your body.

soup.description: A small closed bowl that can hold 0.3L of liquid.

spacedrain.description: Using advanced teleportation technology, it can drain liquids away from you on use. No one really knows where the lost matter goes... Not like that's your problem, though. Automatically recharges.

splint.description: A sturdy board, made to aid fractures. Helps with healing fractures and dislocations. Putting it on a functional limb will still immobilize it, reducing your capabilities.

spraybottle.description: A 0.2L bottle with a spray nozzle on it. Sprays 10ml of liquid at a time. Good for correct use of antiseptics.

steak.description: A big, nicely cooked and prepared piece of meat. Filling, fattening and tasty!

sterilizedbandage.description: A roll of dressing with a bandage, used to slow down bleeding, stabilize fractures and aid skin healing. Counteracts infections. Has no effect on muscle health.

stick.description: A short wooden stick. While it's very frail, it's also light. Way too small to use as a weapon. Could act as a shoddy makeshift hammer.

stonefruitclosed.description: A hard green fruit stuck to a hard, gray part of its plant. You need to separate it using your teeth first.

stonefruitopen.description: A hard green fruit with a neutral taste and medium fat content. It's very dry, you'll probably be thirsty after it.

streptokinase.description: A 100ml syringe with an auto-injector at the end. Dosage is ~34mL.

striderpelt.description: A large piece of thick, fluffy white pelt ripped from a snow strider. Offers considerable insulation from the elements.

string.description: A thin, deceptively durable string made of prepared plant matter. Used in more intricate recipes.

syringe.description: A 100ml syringe which can inject fluid intravenously. It's handmade.

terrainscanner.description: Shows you a low-quality map of the terrain below you. Terrain is highlighted in green, solid buildings in red. Goes 24 meters down.

titaniummachete.description:
A very capable and durable tool for combat, both easy and light to swing, yet razor-sharp and devastating. Its edge is heat treated to keep its sharpness for a long time. An amazing tool for self defense, and can be used as a digging tool as a last resort.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

titaniummultitool.description:
A small, yet very firm and durable tool used for crafting, with a heavy hammer top and a tiny yet razor sharp blade hidden in the handle. While not useful for digging nor combat, it will last neigh indefinitely for all sorts of crafting recipes, and is light.

<color="red">Can be used in the health panel to amputate severely infected limbs.

titaniumpickaxe.description: A finely crafted tool, made out of forged titanium. Very durable and efficient at removing terrain, though not very combat capable.

titaniumrod.description: A solid rod made of a strong titanium alloy. Can be used for advanced crafting, and as a makeshift hammer.

titaniumsheet.description: A thin, yet firm sheet made of a strong titanium alloy. Can be used for advanced crafting.

titaniumslab.description: A rectangular slab made of a strong titanium alloy. Can be used for advanced crafting.

toolbox.description: A big, heavy steel box, made to hold tools.

torch.description: Extremely primitive lightsource. While it lights up the way pretty well, it will be put out by liquids. You can relight it with a bit of fat and a flame source.

tornshirt.description: An old, torn blue shirt. Provides a small bit of protection and insulation.

tourniquet.description: When applied, it cuts off circulation to the limb, stopping all bleeding in the affected area (though it does not heal the wound). It must be removed after some time, as it causes pain and deprives the limb of oxygen. Reusable.

trowel.description: Primitive gardening tool, made of wood and metal. Probably better than using your claws.

turbulentcrystalshard.description: It vibrates with energy. Increases jump height while stored on your body.

tutorialradio.description: You're usually given one of these for the training sessions. Not sure if the messages are live or pre-recorded. It has a button you can press.

tweezers.description: A simple pair of metal tweezers. Can cleanly and painlessly remove shrapnel from limbs.

watch.description: Periodically tells you useful info (bleeding time, hidden infections, weight changes, etc). When used, displays run time and temperature. Having a pocket buddy is comforting!

waterbottle.description: A 0.5L plastic bottle. Comes with clean water.

woodcube.description: Solid cube made of melted together wood. While it's very frail, it's also light.

wooddiggingtool.description: A piece of sharpened wood on a stick. Barely better at digging than claws.

woodpanel.description: Thin sheet made of wood. While it's very frail, it's also light.

woodpickaxe.description: A pickaxe made out of a particularly disappointing material. Efficient at removing terrain, but slow and brittle.

woodpitchfork.description: An agricultural tool used to pitch loose material, such as hay, straw, manure, or leaves. Made of wood.

woodsandals.description: A wood panel attached to your paws with rope. Not comfortable in any way, but it will protect you from sharp debris... If you're lucky, more than one time!

woodscraps.description: Bits and pieces of smashed wood. You could probably make them into a crafting material.

woodshovel.description: A tool specially crafted to efficiently displace soil and other loose materials. Made with a brittle, yet light material.

woodsickle.description: A wooden tool with a curved blade, made to harvest crops or cut through vegetation.

woodtrowel.description: Primitive gardening tool, made of wood. Probably better than using your claws...?

woundglue.description: A 80ml tube, usually filled with wound glue. Applies 20ml of liquid per use.

wrench.description: A tool used to provide grip and mechanical advantage in applying torque to turn objects. Can be used on dislocated limbs to correct them more effectively than with your bare hands. Also makes for a decent hammering tool.

xalorissponge.description: The ripped off, shriveled up spore container of a Xaloris. Can be used a limb to counteract infection or eaten for nutritional value. Its spores might impact your immune system.
